definition[0]: a price-insensitive product is one that sells in the same quantities, whether the price is high or low
example[0]: Basic foods, water and housing are price-insensitive products, which are viewed as necessities of life.
definition[1]: a price-insensitive customer is not influenced by the price of a product when choosing whether or not to buy it
example[1]: Theatre owners are trying to target price-insensitive customers.
